meanings.definition: To fertilize (a plant) by transferring pollen.
meanings.sent1: Bees help pollenize flowers by carrying pollen from one flower to another.
meanings.sent2: Farmers use special tools to pollenize their crops and ensure a good harvest.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to pollenize the garden by spreading pollen everywhere.
meanings.sent4: The wind acted as a natural brush to pollenize the fields with pollen, painting them yellow.
meanings.sent5: In the circle of life, bees play a crucial role to pollenize plants and keep the ecosystem thriving.

meanings.sent1: The flowers easily pollenize when bees visit them for nectar.
meanings.sent2: Plants rely on insects like bees to pollenize them and enable reproduction.
meanings.sent3: The garden seemed to magically pollenize overnight, covered in a fine yellow dust.
meanings.sent4: The air was filled with pollen, ready to pollenize any plant that came in contact with it.
meanings.sent5: Each spring, nature works its magic to pollenize the world, bringing new life to the land.
